title: Delicious Egg Salad Recipe
description: This egg salad recipe is easy to make with hard-boiled eggs, mayo, green onions, and mustard for a deliciously creamy salad perfect for sandwiches.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Egg Salad Recipes Delicious Egg Salad 4.7 (2,278) 1,643 Reviews 270 Photos This egg salad recipe is the best and easy to make with chopped hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, and mustard. I like to add green onions for some color and crunch. It tastes wonderful in a sandwich and will definitely be devoured at picnics! It's really good on rye. Submitted by wifeyluvs2cook Updated on March 27, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 270 270 270 270 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Make deli-worthy egg salad sandwiches at home with this top-rated egg salad recipe! You'll come back to it again and again. How to Make Egg Salad You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Egg Salad Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make the best egg salad of your life: · Eggs: Of course, this egg salad recipe starts with eggs!· Condiments: You'll need mayonnaise and mustard.· Green onion: Green onions lend a pop of flavor, color, and crunch.· Seasonings: This egg salad is simply seasoned with salt, pepper, and paprika. How to Make an Egg Salad Sandwich Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make egg salad sandwiches: 1. Boil, peel, and chop the eggs.2. Combine the chopped eggs and the remaining ingredients.3. Serve on bread or with crackers. How Long Does Egg Salad Last? Store the leftover egg salad in a shallow, airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Can You Freeze Egg Salad? We don't recommend freezing egg salad, as it will change the texture and flavor. If you're OK with that, you can freeze it for up to one month. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. What to Serve With Egg Salad Sandwiches Classic egg salad sandwiches pair best with classic side dishes. Consider a leafy green salad, potato chips, French fries, or coleslaw. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Very good," raves Susan May. "I subbed pickles for the green onion and used Dijon mustard. I liked the addition of paprika. Served it on a bun with lettuce, tomato, and a few more pickle planks." "Great recipe," according to NADIGIRL. "Didn't have green onions so used shallots. Came out great! Will make it again." "Superb," says Teri Peters Sheldon. "Since the best place to start improvising is with something that's perfect, I used this as a base recipe, and added my own little touches. I substituted chives for the green onion, simply because I have an abundance of it in my garden." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 8 large eggs ½ cup mayonnaise ¼ cup chopped green onion 1 teaspoon prepared yellow mustard ¼ teaspoon paprika salt and pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat. Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove eggs from hot water; cool, peel, and chop. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chopped eggs in a bowl; stir in mayonnaise, green onion, and mustard. Season with paprika, salt, and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir and serve on your favorite bread, crackers, or salad greens. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios From the Editor Read our article to find out how to boil eggs perfectly every time! I Made It Print 4,890 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Delicious Egg Salad 01 of 270 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 270 Photo by  C A 08/04/2024 Used a poblano pepper instead of green onions, cut the paprika to a pinch, tastes great 03 of 270 Photo by  Elwayfan 05/07/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Easy to follow, even a confirmed bachelor like me made it on the first try! Highly recommend to all! 04 of 270 Photo by  Melissa H 04/23/2024 Made the egg salad mixture exactly as written. I loved the flavor and texture. I made this on a sandwich bun and added onions, lettuce and tomato. My husband really liked it. My kids said there were to many green onions. 05 of 270 Photo by  Justine Duncan 09/14/2023 So good! I didn't have green onion but it's delicious without it. I topped two Wasa crackers and added more cracked black pepper. 06 of 270 Photo by  Tina 08/15/2023 I always tweek a bit after reading reviews. I should’ve omitted the celery but added a tiny bit of red bell for color. Also I should not have added fresh cracked pepper. It interfered with the texture. Shaker pepper is better. Had to adjust Mayo and mustard because I had huge eggs. 07 of 270 Photo by  ToughGrape9444 08/05/2023 Absolutely delicious! It had the perfect amount of spices and the texture was very smooth and creamy. 08 of 270 Photo by  Ben Wisdom 03/18/2023 Eggcellent! Recipe for hard boiling eggs is spot on. I added salt and vinegar to the water for easier peeling. Used half dijon/half prepared. Next time will only use Dijon. Added some parsley and a pinch of cayenne. Just needs a little crunch. 09 of 270 Photo by  Zosgood 02/02/2023 First time making egg salad. This recipe is delicious! I swapped relish for the onion since I don't like onion. 10 of 270 Photo by  ronnie92051 09/07/2022 Made this with 4 eggs. Celery, green onions, curry powder and paprika, salt and pepper and dill pickle relish. Mayo for base. Little watery, but still delish. Photo is all that is left. Will make again. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Grown-Up Egg Salad Filling 3 Ratings Itlog Na Maalat (Salted Egg Salad) Egg Salad Sandwiches 655 Ratings Avocado Egg Salad 256 Ratings Southern-Style Egg Salad 84 Ratings Awesome Egg Salad with a Kick 194 Ratings Cedar Planked Salmon 870 Ratings Easy Creamy Deviled Eggs 21 Ratings Magical Egg Salad 205 Ratings Avocado-Egg Salad 1 Rating Special Deviled Eggs 519 Ratings Salmon Terrine 11 Ratings California Melt 200 Ratings World's Best Egg Salad Sandwich 19 Ratings Ham and Egg Salad Sandwich Spread 21 Ratings Holiday Hot Spinach Dip 90 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
